data.name: CultureName
data.comment: The name of the culture for the resources

data.name: DateTimeTokenDateOnlyFormatString
data.comment: A format string that contains the date only, where {0} is the date (e.g., "{0}" => "February 14, 2015")

data.name: DateTimeTokenDateTimeFormatString
data.comment: A format string that is the concatenation of the date and time, where {0} is the date and {1} is the time (e.g., "{0} at {1}" => "February 14, 2015 at 2 pm")

data.name: DateTimeTokenTimeOnlyFormatString
data.comment: A format string that contains the time only, where {0} is the time (e.g., "until {0}" => "until 2 pm")

data.name: RelativeDateTokenTodayName
data.comment: The friendly name for today

data.name: RelativeDateTokenTodayPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches today

data.name: RelativeDateTokenTomorrowName
data.comment: The friendly name for tomorrow

data.name: RelativeDateTokenTomorrowPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches tomorrow

data.name: SpecialDateTokenChristmasDayName
data.comment: The friendly name for Christmas Day

data.name: SpecialDateTokenChristmasDayPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches Christmas Day

data.name: SpecialDateTokenNewYearName
data.comment: The friendly name for the New Year

data.name: SpecialDateTokenNewYearPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches the New Year

data.name: SpecialDateTokenNewYearsEveName
data.comment: The friendly name for New Year's Eve

data.name: SpecialDateTokenNewYearsEvePattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches New Year's Eve

data.name: SpecialTimeTokenMiddayName
data.comment: The friendly name for 12 noon

data.name: SpecialTimeTokenMiddayPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches 12 noon

data.name: SpecialTimeTokenMidnightName
data.comment: The friendly name for 12 midnight

data.name: SpecialTimeTokenMidnightPattern
data.comment: The regular expression that matches 12 midnight

data.name: TimeSpanExtensions1DayFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one day with units, where {0} is the number of days with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} day" => "1 day")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensionsNDaysFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N days with units, where {0} is the number of days with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} days" => "5 days")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensions1HourFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one hour with units, where {0} is the number of hours with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} hour" => "1 hour")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensionsNHoursFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N hours with units, where {0} is the number of hours with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} hours" => "5 hours")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensions1MinuteFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one minute with units, where {0} is the number of minutes with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} minute" => "1 minute")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensionsNMinutesFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N minutes with units, where {0} is the number of minutes with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} minutes" => "5 minutes")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensions1SecondFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one second with units, where {0} is the number of seconds with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} second" => "1 second")

data.name: TimeSpanExtensionsNSecondsFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N seconds with units, where {0} is the number of seconds with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} seconds" => "5 seconds")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1DayFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one day with units, where {0} is the number of days with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} day" => "1 day")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNDaysFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N days with units, where {0} is the number of days with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} days" => "5 days")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1HourFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one hour with units, where {0} is the number of hours with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} hour" => "1 hour")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNHoursFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N hours with units, where {0} is the number of hours with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} hours" => "5 hours")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1MinuteFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one minute with units, where {0} is the number of minutes with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} minute" => "1 minute")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNMinutesFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N minutes with units, where {0} is the number of minutes with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} minutes" => "5 minutes")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1MonthFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one month with units, where {0} is the number of months with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} month" => "1 month")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNMonthsFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N months with units, where {0} is the number of months with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} months" => "5 months")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1SecondFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one second with units, where {0} is the number of seconds with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} second" => "1 second")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNSecondsFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N seconds with units, where {0} is the number of seconds with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} seconds" => "5 seconds")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1WeekFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one week with units, where {0} is the number of weeks with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} week" => "1 week")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNWeeksFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N weeks with units, where {0} is the number of weeks with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} weeks" => "5 weeks")

data.name: TimeSpanToken1YearFormatString
data.comment: A format string for one year with units, where {0} is the number of years with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} year" => "1 year")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenNYearsFormatString
data.comment: A format string for N years with units, where {0} is the number of years with a possible fraction part (e.g., "{0} years" => "5 years")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenUnitSeparator
data.comment: The separator between the units of a time span (e.g., " " => "5 minutes 30 seconds", " : " => "5 minutes : 30 seconds")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenLongFormPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches time spans in a long format (e.g., "5 minutes 30 seconds", "1 day 15 hours 30 minutes", "7 minutes 30", "1.5 hours")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenMinutesOnlyPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches integer minutes by themselves (e.g., "5", "15")

data.name: TimeSpanTokenShortFormPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches time spans in a short format (e.g., "5:30", "1:15:30:00", "7:30")

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsApril
data.comment: The string for April

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsAugust
data.comment: The string for August

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsDecember
data.comment: The string for December

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsFebruary
data.comment: The string for February

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsJanuary
data.comment: The string for January

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsJuly
data.comment: The string for July

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsJune
data.comment: The string for June

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsMarch
data.comment: The string for March

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsMay
data.comment: The string for May

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsNndFormatString
data.comment: A format string for an n-nd ordinal number (e.g., "{0}nd" => "2nd")

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsNovember
data.comment: The string for November

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsNrdFormatString
data.comment: A format string for an n-rd ordinal number (e.g., "{0}rd" => "3rd")

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsNstFormatString
data.comment: A format string for an n-st ordinal number (e.g., "{0}st" => "1st")

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsNthFormatString
data.comment: A format string for an n-th ordinal number (e.g., "{0}th" => "4th")

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsOctober
data.comment: The string for October

data.name: DateTimeExtensionsSeptember
data.comment: The string for September

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenAfterNextFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the date that is one week after the next date that is the specified day of the week, where {0} is the day of the week (e.g., "{0} after next" => "Wednesday after next")

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenDaysOfWeekAfterNextPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches days of the week after next (e.g., "Sunday next", "Sunday after next")

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenDaysOfWeekNextPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches days of the week (e.g., "Sunday", "this Sunday", "next Sunday")

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenDaysOfWeekNextWeekPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches days of the week next week (e.g., "Sunday next week")

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenNextFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the next date that is the specified day of the week, where {0} is the day of the week (e.g., "{0}" => "Wednesday")

data.name: DayOfWeekDateTokenNextWeekFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the date next week that is the specified day of the week, where {0} is the day of the week (e.g., "{0} next week" => "Wednesday next week")

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsFriday
data.comment: The string for Friday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsMonday
data.comment: The string for Monday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsSaturday
data.comment: The string for Saturday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsSunday
data.comment: The string for Sunday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsThursday
data.comment: The string for Thursday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsTuesday
data.comment: The string for Tuesday

data.name: DayOfWeekExtensionsWednesday
data.comment: The string for Wednesday

data.name: NormalDateTokenDayAndMonthFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified by a day and month in that order, where {0} is the day and {1} is the month (e.g., "{0} {1}" => "14 February")

data.name: NormalDateTokenDayMonthAndYearFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified by a day, month, and year in that order, where {0} is the day, {1} is the month, and {2} is the four-digit year (e.g., "{0} {1} {2}" => "14 February 2015")

data.name: NormalDateTokenDayOnlyPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches days by themselves

data.name: NormalDateTokenDayOnlyFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified only by a day, where {0} is the ordinal day (e.g., "{0}" => "14th")

data.name: NormalDateTokenMonthAndDayFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified by a month and day in that order, where {0} is the day and {1} is the month (e.g., "{1} {0}" => "February 14")

data.name: NormalDateTokenMonthAndYearFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified by a month and year, where {0} is the month and {1} is the four-digit year (e.g., "{0} {1}" => "February 2015")

data.name: NormalDateTokenMonthDayAndYearFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified by a month, day, and year in that order, where {0} is the day, {1} is the month, and {2} is the four-digit year (e.g., "{1} {0}, {2}" => "February 14, 2015")

data.name: NormalDateTokenMonthOnlyFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified only by a month, where {0} is the month (e.g., "{0}" => "February")

data.name: NormalDateTokenNumericalDateWithDayFirstPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches numerical dates with day first (e.g., "14/02", "14/02/2003")

data.name: NormalDateTokenNumericalDateWithMonthFirstPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches numerical dates with month first (e.g., "02/14", "02/14/2003")

data.name: NormalDateTokenNumericalDateWithYearFirstPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches numerical dates with year first (e.g., "03.02.14", "2003.02.14")

data.name: NormalDateTokenNumericalMonthAndYearPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches months with years (e.g., "2/2015", "02/2015")

data.name: NormalDateTokenSpelledDateWithDayFirstPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches spelled dates with day first and optional year (e.g., "14 February", "14 February 2003")

data.name: NormalDateTokenSpelledDateWithMonthFirstPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches spelled dates with month first and optional year (e.g., "February 14", "February 14, 2003")

data.name: NormalDateTokenSpelledMonthAndOptionalYearPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches spelled months with optional years (e.g., "Jan", "Feb 2015")

data.name: NormalDateTokenYearOnlyFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a date specified only by a year, where {0} is the four-digit year (e.g., "{0}" => "2015")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenAmSuffix
data.comment: The suffix appended to the hour to designate ante meridiem hours (e.g., " am" => "8 am")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenHourPartFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the hour part of a time, where {0} is the hour (e.g., "{0}" => "12")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenMiddaySuffix
data.comment: The suffix appended to 12 to designate midday (e.g., " noon" => "12 noon")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenMidnightSuffix
data.comment: The suffix appended to 12 to designate midnight (e.g., " midnight" => "12 midnight")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenMinutePartFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the minute part of a time appended after the hour part, where {0} is the minute (e.g., "{0:00}" => "12:30")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenPmSuffix
data.comment: The suffix appended to the hour to designate post meridiem hours (e.g., " pm" => "8 pm")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenSecondPartFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the second part of a time appended after the minute part, where {0} is the second (e.g., "{0:00}" => "12:30:15")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenTimeWithoutSeparatorsPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches times without separators (e.g., "5", "5p", "5 pm", "530", "530 p.m.", "53045 p.m.", "1730h")

data.name: NormalTimeTokenTimeWithSeparatorsPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches times with separators (e.g., "5", "5p", "5 pm", "5:30", "5:30 p.m.", "5:30:45 p.m.", "17:30h")

data.name: DateTimeTokenDateOnlyPatternFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a regular expression that matches a date only, where {0} is the date pattern

data.name: DateTimeTokenDateTimePatternFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a regular expression that matches a date and time in that order, where {0} is the date pattern and {1} is the time pattern

data.name: DateTimeTokenTimeDatePatternFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a regular expression that matches a time and date in that order, where {0} is the time pattern and {1} is the date pattern

data.name: DateTimeTokenTimeOnlyPatternFormatString
data.comment: A format string for a regular expression that matches a time only, where {0} is the time pattern

data.name: TimerStartTokenUseDateTimeParserPattern
data.comment: A regular expression that indicates a preference for matching a date and/or time, rather than a time span, when parsing a timer start token

data.name: TimeSpanExtensionsUnitSeparator
data.comment: The separator between the units of a time span (e.g., " " => "5 minutes 30 seconds", " : " => "5 minutes : 30 seconds")

data.name: SoundManagerLoudBeep
data.comment: The string for the loud beep sound

data.name: SoundManagerNormalBeep
data.comment: The string for the normal beep sound

data.name: SoundManagerQuietBeep
data.comment: The string for the quiet beep sound

data.name: ErrorManagerErrorHasBeenWritten
data.value: The error has been written to "{0}".
data.comment: The messsage displayed to the user when an error dump is written to a file, where {0} is the path to the file (e.g., "The error has been written to '{0}'." => "The error has been written to 'C:\error.txt'.")

data.name: ErrorManagerFailedToClean
data.value: Failed to clean old error messages.
data.comment: The message displayed to the user when old error dumps could not be removed

data.name: ErrorManagerUnexpectedError
data.comment: The message displayed to the user when an unexpected error occurs

data.name: CommandLineArgumentsParseExceptionDuplicateSwitchFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the error message displayed when a command-line argument switch is specified more than once, where {0} is the switch that is specified more than once (e.g., "Duplicate switch '{0}'." => "Duplicate switch '--full-screen'.")

data.name: CommandLineArgumentsParseExceptionInvalidTimerInputFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the error message displayed when an invalid timer input is specified as a command-line argument, where {0} is the invalid timer input (e.g., "Invalid timer input '{0}'." => "Invalid timer input 'junk'.")

data.name: CommandLineArgumentsParseExceptionInvalidValueForSwitchFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the error message displayed when a command-line argument switch has an invalid value, where {0} is the switch that has the invalid value and {1} is the invalid value (e.g., "Invalid value '{1}' for switch '{0}'." => "Invalid value 'junk' for switch '--full-screen'.")

data.name: CommandLineArgumentsParseExceptionMissingValueForSwitchFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the error message displayed when a command-line argument switch is missing a value, where {0} is the switch that is missing a value (e.g., "Missing value for switch '{0}'." => "Missing value for switch '--full-screen'.")

data.name: CommandLineArgumentsParseExceptionUnrecognizedSwitchFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the error message displayed when a command-line argument switch is unrecognized, where {0} is the unrecognized switch (e.g., "Unrecognized switch '{0}'." => "Unrecognized switch '--junk'.")

data.name: ContextMenuAlwaysOnTopMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the always on top menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuClearRecentInputsMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the clear recent inputs menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuClearSavedTimersMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the clear saved timers menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuCloseMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the close menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuCloseWhenExpiredMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the close when expired menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuFullScreenMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the full screen menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuLoopSoundMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the loop sound menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuLoopTimerMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the loop timer menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuNewTimerMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the new timer menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuNoRecentInputsMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the no recent inputs placeholder menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuNoSavedTimersMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the no saved timers placeholder menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuNoSoundMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the no sound menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuPopUpWhenExpiredMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the pop up when expired menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuRecentInputsMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the recent inputs menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuSavedTimersMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the saved timers menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuShowInNotificationAreaMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the show in notification area menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ContextMenuSoundMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the sound menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ErrorDialogCloseButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the close button in the error dialog, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ErrorDialogDefaultMessageText
data.comment: The default message displayed in the error dialog

data.name: ErrorDialogShowDetailsButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the show details button in the error dialog, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ErrorDialogTitle
data.comment: The window title for the error dialog

data.name: NotificationAreaIconExitMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the exit menu item, where the character following the optional ampersand (&) is the access key

data.name: NotificationAreaIconNewTimerMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the new timer menu item, where the character following the optional ampersand (&) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowBlankTitlePlaceholder
data.comment: The string used to represent no title in the string representation of a timer window

data.name: TimerWindowCancelButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the cancel button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowCloseButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the close button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowNewTimerWithTitleFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a timer window used when the timer window does not have a running timer and where it does have a title set, where {0} is the current user input into the window and {1} is the timer window title

data.name: TimerWindowPauseButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the pause button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowResetButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the reset button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowResumeButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the resume button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowStartButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the start button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowStopButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the stop button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindowTimerTextHint
data.value: Click to enter time or date
data.comment: The watermark text that is dispalyed in the main input text box in the timer window

data.name: TimerWindowTitle
data.comment: The window title for the timer window

data.name: TimerWindowTitleTextHint
data.comment: The watermark text that is displayed in the timer title text box in the timer window

data.name: TimerWindowUpdateButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the update button in the timer window, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: TimerWindwoNewTimerFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a timer window used when the timer window does not have a running timer, where {0} is the current user input into the window

data.name: UsageDialogCloseButtonContent
data.comment: The text for the close button in the command-line usage dialog, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: UsageDialogDefaultMessageText
data.comment: The default message displayed in the command-line usage dialog

data.name: UsageDialogTitle
data.comment: The window title for the command-line usage dialog

data.name: TimerTimerExpired
data.comment: The string representation of the time left or elapsed for a timer that is expired

data.name: TimerTimerStopped
data.comment: The string representation of the time left or elapsed for a timer that is stopped

data.name: TimerExpiredFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a expired timer, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerExpiredLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a expired timer that is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerExpiredWithTitleFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a expired timer that has a title, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerExpiredWithTitleLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a expired timer that has a title and is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerPausedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a paused timer, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerPausedLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a paused timer that is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerPausedWithTitleFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a paused timer that has a title, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerPausedWithTitleLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a paused timer that has a title and is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerRunningFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a running timer, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerRunningLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a running timer that is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerRunningWithTitleFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a running timer that has a title, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerRunningWithTitleLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a running timer that has a title and is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerStoppedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a stopped timer, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerStoppedLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a stopped timer that is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerStoppedWithTitleFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a stopped timer that has a title, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: TimerStoppedWithTitleLoopedFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of a stopped timer that has a title and is looped, where {0} is the time left, {1} is the timer target, and {2} is the timer title

data.name: NormalTimeTokenMilitaryTimePattern
data.comment: A regular expression that matches military times (e.g., "0500", "1700", "1700h", "1700hrs", "1700 hours")

data.name: NotificationAreaIconTimerExpired
data.comment: The timer expired balloon notification title.

data.name: NotificationAreaIconYourTimerHasExpired
data.comment: The timer expired balloon notification description.

data.name: TimerTimerNotExpired
data.comment: The string representation of the time since the timer expired for a timer that is not expired

data.name: TimerTimeExpiredFormatString
data.comment: A format string for the string representation of the time since the timer expired

data.name: TimerStartDefault
data.comment: The default value for a timer displayed if the user has never started a timer before

data.name: ContextMenuPromptOnExitMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the prompt on exit menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: MessageBoxTitle
data.comment: The caption used for any message boxes

data.name: TimerWindowCloseMessageBoxText
data.value: Are you sure you want to close this timer window?
data.comment: The message displayed when the user closes a timer window while a timer is running

data.name: ContextMenuAdvancedOptionsMenuItem
data.comment: The text for the advanced options menu item, where the character following the optional underscore (_) is the access key

data.name: ThemeManagerWindowSavePrompt
data.value: Do you want to save the changes to the current theme?
data.comment: The prompt displayed when the user tries to close the window or navigate away while there are unsaved changes to a theme

data.comment: The section header text for dark themes

data.comment: The section header text for light themes

data.comment: The section header text for user-provided themes

data.name: ThemeManagerWindowDeletePrompt
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the selected theme?
data.comment: The prompt displayed when the user deletes a theme

data.name: TimerWindowCouldNotLaunchWebBrowserErrorMessage
data.value: To update Hourglass, visit {0} in your web browser.
data.comment: The message in the error dialog shown when the web browser could not be launched to open the download page for the latest version of the app

data.name: TimerWindowCouldNotLaunchWebBrowserErrorTitle
data.comment: The title of the error dialog shown when the web browser could not be launched to open the download page for the latest version of the app
